They have gathered together four classic games from around the world and have designed four of their own games that can all be played on a classic "Alquerque" board.

They found some games which use 12 or less pieces of each color that can all be played on the same board. Next they set out to design a series of new games which use the same pieces and board but have either more modern moves or conditions of victory to make them appeal to today’s game players.

The classic games that you will find in the book are;

Alquerque("Alquerque" is a Checkers variant) from Spain
Seega("Seega") from Africa and Egypt
Cercar La Liebre(similar to "Catch the Hare") also from Spain
Five Field Kono("Five Field Kono") from Korea

The new games from Acorn Games in the book are;

"Fortress", a "condition" game
"Centaurs", a "replacement" game
"Troop", another replacement game
"Neutrino", another condition game

In a "Replacement Game" the players are each trying to get from
their starting point to where their opponent started out from.
Sort of like in "Chinese Checkers"

In a "Condition Game" the players
are trying to be the first player to DO something. This may be to
get something like getting 3-in-a-row as in TicTacToe but not
mattering WHERE on the board you achieve this.

Solid wood construction and pieces as well as a clearly written rule book with diagrams make this a sure bet with teachers and game players alike.

Not described but playable with the included board of the board game collection as well: "Bagh Bandi", Bagh Chal from Nepal, and Fanorona Dimy (a Fanorona variant on a five times five board) from Madagascar. Rules available in BGG.

23842.name: MadWish
23842.description:
MadWish is an electrifying party game which will make all your MAD wishes come true. MadWish combines the best drinking elements with flirting and snitching co-players. Playing MadWish with friends will guarantee a hilarious night never to be forgotten.

A wheel of fortune game which should play at its best when there is an equal number of male and female players playing. There are things you have to do and truths you have to tell during the game and your aim is to gather the predetermined amount of money before others do. A thing you must do in the course of the game could be for example sending an SMS to your ex claiming that he or she really is lousy in bed...

23843.name: Clone
23843.description:
From back of box:

Clone is a challenging new game that combines skill and luck on a unique battlefield. The objective is to attack and eliminate your opponent's forces and prevent them from cloning lost pieces by destroying their cloning stations. Whether advancing your forces across the board into enemy territories or beaming them directory into any territory via transport stations, you'll find 'Clone' to be a game that will bring hours of fun for family and friends.

Owner's description:

A six sided board with locations for cloning stations on the outside and transportation portals on the inside with hex spaces between. Each player plays one (or more) color and has 6 cloning stations and 6 playing pieces. Playing pieces have different values (2 each of one, two and three) and can only capture those of like value or below (a la Stratego).

Three different six-sided dice control your possible choices for action each turn. The 'Movement' die is numbered 1-2-3-1-2-3 and controls how far you can move and how large a piece you may clone each turn. The 'Clone' die with 5 blank sides and 'Clone' printed on the remaining side determines whether you can bring a captured piece back and also allows you to roll again. The remaining 'Control' die determines what combination of actions you may take: Attack, Teleport, enter or exit a Cloning Station.

23844.name: Daler
23844.description: In the year 1613 The Danish King Christian IV forbade cursing and gaming. Daler is one of the games which was played at open seas behind the canons of the ship, because the gamblers were afraid of getting caught in the act. The game is a simple dice game for gamblers.

23845.name: Roller Rumble
23845.description: Another board game by PLAAY.com. This one was a game depicting the world of Roller Derby. The game is played using statistical data on players.

23846.name: Crash and Scramble
boardgameimplementation: Lacrosse Blast Pro Indoor Lacrosse Game
23846.description: In their attempt to continue to offer sport games that are not-so-ordinary PLAAY games released Crash and Scramble as one of their last release before their demise. Crash and Scramble brought the fury that is professional Lacrosse to the gaming table.

23847.name: First Contact: YOUR TOWN
23847.description:
What if intelligent beings from another planet decided to forcibly take possession of planet Earth by taking over people's bodies? And what if the place they landed to begin implementation of this takeover was YOUR TOWN? And...what if YOU were the only one who KNEW about it?

PLAAY's venture into the non-sports arena had them hosting an invasion of Earth. The game boasted as many of theirs did a solid solitaire game system.

23848.description:
Welcome to the 13th Century town of Hameln (Hamlyn). Townspeople go about the business of living - buying houses, having children, marrying, earning an honest coin and trying to get one up on their neighbors.

However, their way of life is under threat...a plague of rats has arrived. As the number of rats rise the levels of food and romantic thoughts dwindle.... where is the Pied Piper when you need him ? Beware though, the Pied Piper plays his music at a price and his talents stretch beyond simply charming rats.

Players score points for houses, influence, money and possession of the cat. Losing children to the Pied Piper is considered bad form and will lose you points.
23848.name: Hameln

23849.name: Heroes of Might and Magic V Collectible Card and Tile Game
23849.description:
The second demon war is at hand! the epic battle between Haven and Inferno reignites with this spectacular translation of Ubisoft's brand new release, Heroes of Might and Magic V. Choose a side in the primary clash or elect a separate path by hoisting the flag of the Necropolis, Academy, Dungeon or Sylvan forces.

This 3rd volume in DGA's Ultimate Fantasy Wargame series will keep you and your friends captivated for hours each time you break open the box!


from DGAGAMES website*


With a similar game system to Heroes of Might and Magic IV CTG, the differences mirror those of the computer game series. See for yourself the immense difference it makes when your armies MUST be lead by Heroes-Heroes who cannot be directly targeted in battle. Fans of the ever popular Heroes of Might and Magic III will be pleasantly surprised with the similarities in both style and content.

23850.name: Hop Little Frog
23850.description:
One day four hungry frogs went hunting. When they got to the edge of the pond nearby, they each spotted a fly on the other side that they wanted to catch. The only problem was how they would get to the other side? They thought that a path of lily pads pads would be the answer, but there were not enough lily pads to go around. Their problem can be solved with the help of the die, so join them and catch the fly!

In Hop Little Frog, the frogs hop across the pond to catch the flies, but to do so they must first of all "make the lily pads grow".

23851.description:
Tiger of Ethiopia was published in Command Magazine 6 and is a variant of Lion of Ethiopia (published in Command Magazine 4 which is required in order to play this variant).

In this alternate history, Nazi Germany and Japan were victorious in WW II have turned on each other to start WWW III in 1948. This game deals with the Japanese invasion of the Horn of Africa as a southern pincer to Black Gold (a stand-alone game published separately along with Mississippi Banzai), to tear the entire Middle East away from German/Italian control. Japanese have air superiority, the first Japanese tank army, Andean mountain units and Ethiopian guerrillas and other Japanese units against the Italian Army (same units as the Italian army of 1936 in Lion of Ethiopia). The Afrika Korps, British SS legions and Arab SS cavalry legions enter as reinforcements.

One 22" x 34" map.
Divisional level with a few brigades/regiments/battalions.
23851.name: Tiger of Ethiopia

23853.name: Polus
23853.description: A challenging dice game for 2-6 players: The players take turns throwing two dice each; every player may use 3 dice throw at the most to get 5, 10, 15, 20 or 25 points. The player who reach 100 first wins the game.

23854.name: Ultra Quick Tennis
23854.description:
From the Publisher's website:

Announcing Ultra-Quick Tennis!

My goal in designing this game was to develop a mechanism to quickly play through a tennis tournament. With other tennis games, either the game took too long to realistically complete a full tournament, or the game was too simplistic and produced far too many upsets. As with all of my games, I wanted a quick playing design that closely mirrored reality in the tennis world. The end result is a game that I´m very proud of.

Ultra-Quick Tennis has been thoroughly tested for statistical accuracy. I am extremely confident that the formulas employed in the game accurately represent each player. To make it a game, I´ve added some elements of chance, as well as some rare play results. Overall, I think you´ll find the winners to be on par with what you would reasonably expect.

Ultra Quick Tennis includes over 300 professional men from the 2005 ATP Tour and well over 400 professional women from the 2005 WTA Tour. Also included are the full schedules for both Tours.

Players are accurately rated for each playing surface found on the respective Tours. You'll experience the sheer dominance of Roger Federer on grass. Clay court specialists like Guillermo Coria will shine at Roland Garros, but prove to be mortal on the hard courts at the US Open. Every player will realistically perform as they did in actual tennis competition during the 2005 campaign.

All of the unusual events that can happen in tennis like injuries, retirements, loss of concentration, arguing line calls all happen in Ultra Quick Tennis as well. The ball is in your court, purchase Ultra Quick Tennis today!

23855.name: Ultra Quick Football
23855.description:
From the publisher's website:

Ultra Quick Football provides you with over 600 teams from the 2004-04 collegiate season. All teams from Division 1A to Division III are rated. UQ Football also provides you with the 2004-05 NFL Season, 2004 Canadian Football League, 2004 NFL Europe, and the 2004-05 Arena Football League.

No other game provides you with as many teams in one package!

As with our entire Ultra Quick lineup, individual games play in seconds. With Ultra Quick Football, you can easily play out a team's entire season in one sitting. You can play an entire league in hours, rather than days, weeks, months or years like other games.

In ultra Quick Football, all teams are rated for Offensive Ability, Defensive Ability, and Home Field Advantage. The NFL is also rated for Home Field Advantage in Playoff games. The College teams are rated for Strength of Schedule, so you can accurately match up any two teams.

Get on the field today with Ultra Quick Football!

23856.name: Bulyah
23856.description:
Armed with the beverage of their choice, players of BULYAH take turns rolling dice and moving around the board, trying to collect enough Letter Cards to spell the word, "BULYAH." In true board game fashion, there are stops along the way that try to prevent players from reaching their goal. These stops are what make the game interesting and bring the drinking into the picture.

Before play begins, a 4-ounce glass is filled to the brim with the beverage of everyone’s choice and is placed in the middle of the board. The "Grave" will be consumed many times throughout the game, as players either land on a "Grave Stone" space on the board or are instructed to do so by one of the 100 Action Cards. When an Action Card is drawn, the player must follow the command designated. These can range from announcing, "I am stupid" before taking a drink, to revealing one of your most embarrassing moments, to acting as servant to all of the other players by refilling their drinks, and even making up your own rule as the "Rule Master." Oh yeah, be weary of the Prison and Hospital spaces, however, you can gain relief by hiding out in the "Safety Zone".

Contents: One party board, 100 Action cards, 60 Letter cards, two die, and six tokens.

23857.description:
Second volume in the "Au fil de l'Epée" series.
It covers 4 Medieval battles: Bremule, Taillebourg, Mons-en-Pevele ,and Cassel.

The game has high quality color components:
- Rulebook (8 color pages)
- Historical and scenario booklet (14 color pages)
- 3 token sheets to be mounted (415 token)
- 4 maps (2 A3 format and 2 A3x2).
- Available in English or French
23857.name: Epées Royales

23858.name: Batman
23858.description: Based on the comic book of the 70's, Batman by Hasbro is an exciting crime fighting game where you play the dynamic duo. Gotham's evilest criminals have run amok in the city and it's up to Batman and Robin to capture them and return then to the Bat Cave.

23859.name: Murder à la carte: Eat, Drink, and Be Married
23859.description:
The mystery: Welcome to Vegas with it's glitzy casinos and show-stopping entertainment. The deck is stacked against wealthy casino owner, Blackjack White, as he bursts into the love-me chapel to stop his beautiful naive daughter from marrying a burly biker named Ezekiel Z. Ryder. Alas, Blackjack is shot dead by a member of the wedding party. Don't bet on the guilty suspect...it may be you...

Includes party planner, character booklets for all suspects including their roles and background information, 8 place cards, 8 party invitations & envelopes, 6 secret clues, and cassette tape with an introduction, summary of events, and the solution to the crime.

23860.name: Branson the Game
23860.description:
Take a vacation to Branson, Missouri. While playing the game, players roll dice, move around the floor, and collect as many Vacation Cards as possible. At the end of thirty minutes, the player with the most Vacation Cards is the winner.
Vacation Cards include Show-Time Cards, Meal-Time Cards and Fun-Time Cards. There are also Action Cards which include Think-Fast Cards, Audition Cards and Good News/Bad News Cards. Side loop trips also offered on the game board.
Very colorful board with playing pieces in the shapes of little family sedans. The good news: no money involved.
BONUS: This is a virtual time capsule of Branson in 1992. Many of the attractions and stars featured on the game board are no longer in Branson or have passed away. Includes Boxcar Willie, John Davidson, Wayne Newton, Tony Orlando, Ray Stevens, Jim Stafford and more!

23861.name: Kort Alfapet
23861.description: KortAlfapet is a card variant of ALGAs Alfapet. Try to lay out as long words as you can with the cards in your hand, to get as many points as possible.

23862.name: Battle for Tromaville
23862.description:
Dr. Killernoff, the pollution breathing alien from the planet Smogular, has come to Tromaville. Unless we team up with Toxie and the Good Guys, Tromaville is doomed. Apocalypse, Inc. and the Bad Guys are out to destroy us! Let's go get 'em!

Objective of the game is to be the first player to travel the board and get back safely to Toxie's headquarters.

You become one of the Toxic Crusaders as you travel the path through Tromaville. You will battle the sinister Bad Guy cards with Toxic Crusaders Good Guy cards. You'll be challenged to fight the pollutant mutants of Apocalypse Inc. wherever they spread toxic disaster.
On each turn, players move along the game path. The path leads through six endangered areas of Tromaville. Players battle the Bad Guys and clean up Bad stuff as they follow instructions on the game board. The first player to reach Toxerific is the winner.

Ages 6 and up

23863.name: Gosix
23863.description:
Gosix is an abstract strategy game played on a 7 hexagons board. You're trying to control 4 of the 7 hexagons. The trick is: whenever you get control over a hexagon, you lose some of the pawns that made you win.

Players take turns placing a pawn on the board. You must discover how to win while losing as few pawns as possible, or "help" your opponent to win and have him lose as many pawns as possible.

23864.description:
Clobber is played by two players, White and Black, on a rectangular
checkerboard, often of size n*(n+1) for some n. However, in the Computer
Olympiads Clobber is played on 10x10-boards.

In the initial position, all squares are occupied by a stone, with white stones on the white squares and black stones on the black squares. A player moves by picking up one of their stones and "clobbering" an opponent's stone on an adjacent square (horizontally or vertically).
The "clobbered" stone is removed from the board and replaced by the stone that was moved. The game ends when one player, on their turn, is unable to move, and then that player loses.
23864.name: Clobber

23865.name: Nazca
23865.description: The lines on the floor of the Nazca Valley in the Peruvian Andes have mystified us since their discovery in the early years of the last century. In this game, you assume the role of a Nazca village leader, managing your villagers and assigning them to tasks. The rewards of these labors are the resources you need to build the legendary Nazca Lines.

23866.name: Buck Rogers Game: Adventures in the 25th Century
23866.description:
From the box:

Join Captain Buck Rogers and Colonel Wilma Deering, commander of the Intercept Squadron, as they blast off from Earth to battle marauding space pirates. Take over the Draconian flagship, the pirates' base, and halt the invasion.

The game is based off the early 80s TV show of the same name.

According to daVinci editrice (online): "you just have to follow the instructions on two disks (one to determine the movements of the ships, and the other one for the actions to make when two ships are in the same point). The object of the game is to be the first player (there can be 2-4 of them) to board the Draconian ship with both his ships, that have to be moved from one side to the other of the board."

23867.name: The Game of Mythology
23867.description:
An instructional card game meant to teach players the names, history, functions, and associations of characters and locations in classical mythology.

The game is played with 76 different cards, which each tell the story of a different mythological figure.

Included is a pronunciation card, a 2-sided instruction card, and a 4 pages "background" by "the compiler": Laura Wheaton Abbot Cooke, Chicago, Ill., March 1884.

The object of the game is to collect the cards into "books" (melds). The one who collects the greatest number of books wins the game.

A book is composed of five specific cards (i.e. Jupiter - the number 1 card- +Saturn + Neptune + Rhea + Ceres). A typical card from the deck shows the name of a god, a small illustration of the god, the names of the four other gods which form a book, and (the largest section) a History, which is not used in game play. Note that the cards are in black and white, so the books lack the modern convenience of color-matching borders.

There are also a couple of "location" cards which have special effects.

23868.name: Trezo
23868.description: Using a game board of 27 spaces and 27 unique playing pieces, players try to form a group of three pieces with a like attribute (color, height, shape) or three pieces with no matching attribute. Each piece has one of three attributes in each of three categories - Color (red, green or yellow), Height (short, medium or tall) and Shape (square, triangle, circle).

23869.name: The Glass Bead Game
23869.description:
The Glass Bead Game was created by the Dutch game inventor Christian Freeling in the late 1970s. It was named after the final novel of the German writer Hermann Hesse which was published in 1943 ("Das Glasperlenspiel"). Hesse was put on the Black List of the Nazis while living as a refugee in Switzerland. After continental Europe was liberated, Hesse was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1946. Freeling's game is one of many conceptualizations that were inspired by Hesse's novel.

The Glass Bead Game was described by R. Wayne Schmittberger in his book New Rules for Classic Games in 1992 and was so made popular in America. The game differs from most traditional Mancala games in having counters with different values. Another unusual concept of the game is that there are two types of capturing (direct and indirect). The game can be played online at Freeling's homepage.

23870.description:
From the publisher:

Strange Defeat is a sequel to Defiant Russia and Red Vengeance. Like those games, it’s designed as an easy to learn, fun game. The map portrays the Netherlands, Belgium, western Germany and northern France.


Players control the actual units that fought in this campaign; most of them represent army corps with a handful of divisions. The typical Allied unit is as good as the typical German unit, and many of them are better. The German player must play to his or her advantages: an air force designed for tactical support, parachute regiments to assault key points, and concentration of force.

Like Defiant Russia and Red Vengeance, Strange Defeat isn't a very large game. The map is 34 x 22 inches, divided into very large hexes for ease of play. There are 140 playing pieces, and it comes in a small box that's easy to store. The game plays very quickly, concluding in about 90 minutes, with a minimum of charts and tables to consult. The game uses the same system as Defiant Russia.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 day
Hex: 15 miles / 24.1 kilometers
Units: Regiment to Corps

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" five color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (140 1/2" counters)
One 16-page Strange Defeat
One Player Aid/Errata Card
Two 6-sided dice

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 1-2 Hours
23870.name: Strange Defeat:  The Fall of France, 1940

23871.name: Daruma Otoshi
23871.description:
Daruma Otoshi is a Japanese cultural toy. The first part of the name "Daruma" is the name of the doll (usually the face of a angry-looking Japanese samurai-like guy, but also can be friendly looking, depends on the artist who draws the face),"Otoshi" means "to drop".

This traditional Japanese game requires a good eye and fast reflexes. The purpose of the game is to knock the center pieces out with the hammer without causing the doll on top to fall over. The doll on top is called daruma; he represents the Buddhist priest Bodhidharma who is said to have lost the use of his arms and legs after meditating for nine years. Today daruma are used as a charm for the fulfillment of a special wish, for example, passing the entrance exam to high school or winning an election. The character written on this darumas belly reads gfuku,h or good fortune. Japanese children can play with daruma otoshi when they are alone by seeing how many blocks they can knock out before daruma topples over. They may also play it with friends and take turns until someone causes daruma to fall over.

Usually made of solid wood.

Similar to:

BASH!
Toc Toc Woodman

23873.name: Hot Hoops
23873.description:
Hot Hoops is a battery-operated game that can be played by either one or two players. Each player selects a plastic player shooter and a set of balls to shoot baskets into a revolving backboard. The player with the most baskets at the end of 8 balls wins the game.

From the manufacturer's website:

In the mood for a little basketball action? Well, with Hot Hoops, the basketball game, you can shoot hoops whenever and wherever you want! One-on-one gaming action provides hours of intense basketball fun!

Hot Hoops Basketball Game includes four basketballs for non-stop play

FEATURES:

Be the First Player to Shoot All the Basketballs Successfully through the Hoop (Thereby Ridding Yourself of All the Balls) to Win
Connected Basketball Hoops allow Basketball to Pass from One Player to Another Thereby Increasing the Competitive Play
1- or 2-Player Game
Spring-loaded Lever Enables Quick and Challenging Basketball Shooting
Game Folds Up with Easy-Grip Handle for Easy Transport and Storage

23874.name: A Little Golden Book Circle of Friends Game
23874.description:
Spin the spinner and move your Golden Book Token clockwise around the spiraling gameboard. Each time you land on a Saggy Baggy Elephant FACE Square, turn over a card from the stack. If you turn over a Saggy Baggy Elephant card, move forward on the game board to the next Saggy Baggy Elephant Square and turn over another card. If the card you turn over is not Saggy, move forward to the nearest square that matches that character card. Your turn is over. If you land on a BIG Saggy Baggy Elephant and his trunk points to another square, follow his trunk (up or down) to that square.

The first player to reach the CIRCLE OF FRIENDS, land on the Final Saggy Baggy Elephant FACE Square and turn over a matching Elephant card, enters the Circle and wins the game!

23875.name: The New York Game
23875.description:
(from game insert:)
Now New York is a game! And playing the subway can be fun..

Take the subway to 6 of New York's fascinating places of interest. You'll find 36 of them on THE NEW YORK GAME board. Change lines! Detain every player to your advantage. Let those delays, repairs and mix-ups obstruct your opponents' progress. The first one to return to his starting point wins.

THE NEW YORK GAME keeps things moving. It's fast. It's fun. Skill and chance work together to insure a great time for all. And, when the game is over, you'll be surprised to see how much you have learned about the city of New York.

Sibling: The Boston Game
Sibling: The London Game

23876.name: Opinions
23876.description:
Do you have the gift of the gab? In the tradition of the great orators, players are challenged to express their opinion on hundreds of issues (many of which are hilarious). Enhances creativity and lateral thinking and ideal for anyone wishing to improve their public speaking skills. 3 to 8 players. Ages 8 to adult.

At the heart of the game are the 500 ‘Opinion’ cards. When a player lands on an Opinion Square he or she becomes ‘the Candidate’, draws an Opinion Card and reads it to the other players. The Candidate then selects an opponent from amongst the other players who is now called ‘the Opposition’. The Candidate argues in favor of the Opinion for up to a minute. Players cannot choose sides - they must argue the Opinion as it stands - whether they agree with the statement or not.

The opposing player then argues against the opinion. The remaining players vote for the best argument - not for the argument they agree with - but for the best defended position.

Because the voters are not casting a secret ballot, but have to justify why they think an argument was good or bad, this part of the game can get pretty raucous as players try to convince each other that someone’s argument was absolute balderdash.

Opinions, however, is not just about arguing an opinion. There is a whole story to the game which unfolds as players race for the Presidency. Good and bad press, in the form of the 500 Press Cards, alternatively encourages or plagues players as they seek support for their campaigns. Get arrested in a riot, take a vacation in the Caribbean, rescue a kitten and meet the Queen as your career unfolds (or unwinds!). get caught in compromising situations or rewarded for your service to the community as you work your way to the top.

23878.description:
Star Wars: Stolen Plans is a fast paced 'Print and Play' Card Game that can be played with 2 players but is best with 3 or more players.
Players will take it in turns to draw a card, or play a card, trying to acquire the droid carrying the stolen plans. Once a player has possession of the stolen plans card they will soon discover that keeping hold of it is a different challenge as their opponents steal, and attack, to gain the advantage.

This is a free Print and Play game. All of the necessary files can be found in the files section below.

Star Wars is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.
23878.name: Star Wars: Stolen Plans Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ook ook ook! oook oooook! Hooya!

23879.name: Sacoma!
23879.description:
Each player has 6 pieces to place on the outer edge of a hex-shaped pattern of holes forming 3 concentric circles. After placement they then take turns moving one piece, with no more than three pieces allowed in a line and no more than two of the same color.

One point is scored for each piece in the middle ring and two points for each piece in the center ring - with none for the outer ring. The winner is the first person to eight points.

23880.name: Pocket Geni: Militärhistoria
23880.description:
Swedish trivia game in the Geni series. This one is co-published by a military history book club/association. Questions on Swedish and international military history written by colonel Einar Lyth.

Contents:
75 cards with 450 questions on military history
One pad of score sheets
2 special dice
1 pencil

12 years and up. Playable in teams, so in theory it accommodates 24 people or even more.

From the summary of other Geni titles:
Players roll a die to determine what category of question to answer. If they answer it correctly, they get to mark one such symbol on a score sheet. The goal is to score a complete line across the score sheet. There is also a twelve-sided die with "GENI" on some of the faces. If a player rolls that and gets "GENI", he gets to choose what category question to answer. If he gets a blank face, he doesn't get any question at all this turn.

23881.name: College Pursuit
23881.description:
(from the rules booklet)

The purpose of College Pursuit is to make studying for the Scholastic Aptitude Tests (SATs) a little easier, a lot more fun, and consequently, much more valuable to you. It is both a game, which encourages repeated play and review, and an educational tool that:

Increases your comprehension and retention of material;

Pinpoints each player's area of weakness;

Gives you actual SAT equivalent scores as an indication of accomplishment.

23882.name: National Treasure Board Game
23882.description:
"The Clues Are Right In Front Of Your Eyes."

This was a press kit of sorts for the film, it contains trivia based around the film, such as questions about other films with Nicolas Cage and some historical trivia related to the film's plot.

Contents: National Treasure Playing Board, 4 Markers, 1 Deck of 30 Trivia Cards, 4 Sets of four Monument Cards, 1 “All-Seeing Eye” spin wheel, 1 Winner Card In Sealed Envelope, and DVD of promotional materials. The box measures 11 x 21 1/2.

23884.name: Top Secret Adventures
23884.description:
Based on the Highlights® Top Secret Adventures series, this game helps children expand their knowledge of world geography.

Each player is an agent on a top secret mission. Use the world map on the game board to help answer geography quiz cards and gather data cards as you go. Be the first to collect a correct set of data cards revealing the suspect, place and missing item to successfully complete your mission and win!

23885.name: Goblin Wood
23885.description:
From the box:

Goblin Wood is the home of mischievous Goblins and naughty magpies. As a snail you must follow the bridal paths through the wood in search of the golden keys to the castle on the hill. But beware! The Goblins and magpies lie in wait, ready to steal your golden keys. The first player to reach the castle with a key is the winner.

Goblin Wood is the first in a new and exciting range of quality toys, puzzles and boardgames from Play Games UK Ltd. It's very simple to play, will improve the memory skills, is full of decision making and is extremely colorful and packed with fun. The constant changes in the direction of play ensure that you'll never tire of playing Goblin Wood."

23886.name: Dungeons of Demus
23886.description:
From the box:

"The all action sword and sorcery game.

Prevent Demus from seizing the throne and enslaving the land.

Enter the castle and defeat the Necromancer.

Pit your wits against the evil Demus.

Demus intends to capture the Throne of Laithnur and bring a great darkness to the land. In this perilous hour only a Hero of iron will and brave heart, can stop him!
Your quest is to enter the Castle of Laithnur and prevent the evil Demus from taking the Throne and enslaving the land and its people for all time."

23887.name: Rage! Game
23887.description:
The Rage! Game is very similar to the better known game Aggravation.

The board game is a cross made of two plastic halves, and when put together it forms a track of many dimples along the perimeter. Each player has 4 marbles that they move along the track from their starting position, trying to get them into home, after traversing the board. There are 5 dimples in the middle of the board that you can use as a short cut, but you need to roll specific numbers to use it.

If you land on another player's marble by exact count, you move it back to its starting position.

23888.name: RithmaSpace
23888.description:
From the game:

"The object of the game is simply to occupy four colored spaces. There are 8 spaces to aim for so the task shouldn't be too difficult. Although the final task remains the same, there are four versions of Rithma that get progressively harder and finally allow you to play really deviously. For all the versions each player starts with four cube pieces of one color and chooses a target space (cyan, magenta or gold) to aim for."

The board is 7x7 squares and each square is either colored or has a shape in it. A piece moving off the shapes has to move the number of spaces that the shape has sides - 3 for a triangle, 4 for a square and 5 for a pentagon.

23889.name: Stack'em
23889.description:
The game's objective is to be the first to place three pieces in a row. A four-ringed board perches on top of a post. Players take time rolling the die, then placing one of their pieces on the ring indicated by the die roll. The uppermost two rings can be twisted. One die result is to twist these rings--without toppling the board and the pieces. Once each player has placed all their pieces on the board, the player with the most lines of 3 pieces wins the game.

Similar to:

Topple

boardgamehonor: 2006 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Nominee
2006 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Winner
2007 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
2007 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Childgame Nominee
2008 Boardgames Australia Awards Best Children's Game Nominee
23890.description:
The good, honest seafarers sail from one treasure island to the next. However, Salvador Sea Devil, the Black pirate stays hard on their heels trying to pillage their treasures. Using his vessel, the "Black Svenja", Salvador Sea Devil quickly approaches and tries to board the seafarers' boats. The seafarers immediately set sail. Suddenly a strong gust of wind whistles around their heads and as the sails tighten the boat skims across the sea. At the very last moment they escape from Salvador, the Sea Devil.

The game board shows the sea and various islands. The six islands with harbor are the treasure islands. On each treasure island there is a colored flag. Put a gold coin on each treasure island.
One island shows the flag of the pirate: this is the pirate‘s island. Put the pirate vessel into the bay of the pirate island.
Each player takes a little bag and a boat of the same color. Place your boat on the ship of the corresponding color shown in the center of the game board.
The remaining gold coins, the bellows and both dice are kept ready next to the game board.

At sea, there is nearly always a strong wind blowing. Sailing boats use the force of the wind: the big sails gather the wind, which then propels the ships forward. You can provoke strong gusts of wind with the bellows, to move the ships on.
boardgameversion: Haba Multilingual edition with SdJ logo
23890.name: Der schwarze Pirat
boardgamepodcastepisode: D6G Ep 54: Games for All Ages, Blue Oyster Cult Interview, & Peter Lipton
Episode 49: Der Schwarze Pirat
TPGC - Episode #56 - Penney Hockey, Iceburg Hustle, The Black Pirate and Klondike
Wooden Cubes & Iron Soldiers: “Just the Two of Us” Episode 8

boardgamehonor: 2006 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Recommended
23891.description:
Farmer Marble ball has set out to the fields to harvest turnips. As soon as he is out of sight, there is great turmoil on the farm! The cows play whilst the pig surfs on the internet. The rooster stays on the lookout for the master's return. He uses binoculars to help see Farmer Marble ball from far away.

Suddenly the dog has a brilliant idea for a game! The animals stand all around the courtyard and in a flash there is a little mouse rolling through their legs. What fun! Suddenly there is a loud "cock-a-doodle-doo" form the manure heap. Farmer Marble ball comes homes from the harvest with huge turnips and the animals quickly stop playing and pretend nothing has happened.

Contents:
6 Animals
1 roller-ball
4 pegs (mini-clothes-pins) (in four colors)
4 wooden disks (in four colors)
1 flicking rod
12 cards
1 hourglass
1 semi-sphere
1 set of instructions
23891.name: Die Kullerbande

23893.name: Milwaukee Scene
23893.description:
A Monopolyesque game themed around late seventies Milwaukee, WI USA.

The object of the game is to accumulate wealth by buying and selling significant local entities such as: Pabst, Schlitz, or Miller Breweries; The Mecca; Marquette University; Summerfest; or The Milwaukee Brewers MLB team.

"Have you ever wanted to own the Hyatt Regency, a radio station, the Brewers or Admirals? Now is your chance by playing the Milwaukee Scene!" --John N. Hansen, 1979

Players may become politicians, labor leaders, or publishers, as well as owners of professional sports teams in this game. Connection cards are sought to enable owners to develop properties in order to increase rents, and to do so requires bargaining with other players.

So, why not sit down with a Miller High Life or MGD and make a decision to buy the brewery which produces it? Sorry Laverne and Shirley, Schlitz is no more, and Pabst left town for good...

Inventory:

1 playing board
50 Scene Cards (including two blanks)
25 Ownership Cards (deeds)
3 Debtor Cards
4 Power Group Badges
16 Connection Cards
6 Tokens
2 Dice
1 Card With Colored Circular Markers
5 Deominations/Money

23894.name: Chandal Mandal
23894.description:
"The game of Chandal Mandal"

A variation of Chaupar, the national game of India. Chaupar later became Parcheesi - aka Ludo - in the west. Invented by Akbar the Great, ruler of India, who lived from 1542 to 1605.

Think of it as 16 player Chaupar, with 16 arms instead of 4, and you are a long way there. The board is made out of 16 parallelograms arranged in a circle around a centre. Each parallelogram is divided in 24 fields, in 3 rows of 8. Each of the 16 players get 4 pawns each. Four (traditional) dice are used, with the longer sides marked 1,2,10 and 12. As in Chaupar, the pieces are moved anti-clockwise, and go around the whole circle. The first player out wins the agreed amount from all other 15, and each subsequent finisher also gets that same amount from whoever is still left to finish. So the last player loses the most.

His Majesty seemed to play 12 broad variations:

1. No pawn can remove another pawn, but it moves on by itself instead.
2. Single pawns may be captured, and are sent back to start.
3. With each throw two pawns are moved at a time (with or without the option to capture).
4. Three or four pawns are moved like this.
5. The dice are thrown four times, and four pawns are moved at each throw.

Usually players would all move in the same direction, but sometimes some players would move anti-clockwise, whilst other would play clockwise.

6. A player is out when he reaches the starting point of the player directly opposite, moving from the middle row of his opposite number into the empty centre space. Longer games would require players to reach the starting point of the player sitting on the left.
7. Each player has three throws. On the first throw two own pawns are moved, on the second throw, the player moves one own pawn, and one pawn belonging to the player on the right. On the third throw, again, one own pawn gets moved, plus the player on the left may also move one pawn belonging to that player. Pawns belonging to neighbours cannot be removed, and when they land in the same row as a player's own pieces, they are moved as if they belonged to the throwing player.
8. Two pawns together may hit two other pawns, but single pawns cannot hit each other.
9. Four pawns combined can remove 3 pawns, 3 pawns can hit groups of 2, 2 can hit single pawns, but single pieces cannot remove any.
10. A player whose turn it is moves according to the dice rolled, the player opposite him moves at the same time, but uses the eyes of the bottom side of the dice, whilst the players on the left and right also move, but according to the eyes on the left and right face of the rolled die.
11. Five dice are rolled. The active player moves the sum of the two highest rolls. The next highest roll is used by the person on the opposite side of the board. The lowest two rolls are used by the players sitting on the left and right.
12. Five dice and five pawns. At every throw, the result of one of the rolled dice is given to the player on the right. In a variation to this, the thrower would name four players before rolling, and would give one result to each of these players, keeping only the fifth die. And when only a few points are left to get pukhtah, the remaining points go to those near to where the dice come to rest.

If the game was played by less people the board and the number of dice thrown would be amended accordingly. It is highly likely the boards were frequently life-sized and groups of slave girls were sent around the track, dressed in appropriate colours.

Brief history: ask anyone to name great rulers of history and you are unlikely to hear the name Akbar, ruler of the Mughal Empire (1556-1605). Leaving remarkable military and administrative successes, and a fondness for alcohol and women to one side, the illiterate and, at times, brutal man, also had a passion for religious tolerance and class harmony. He surrounded himself with scholars, thinkers and poets, and was persuaded by the Plato school that argued that a great ruler should be like a philosopher-king. Whilst trying to unify the different religions, he became a great patron of the arts and literature, for which he is best remembered. Thanks to the recordings in the "Ain I Akabari", third volume of the "Akbarnāma", a detailed biography and history record kept by his close advisor and court scribe, Abu'l Fazl, we know that the good bloke also had a weak spot for games, and had even invented a game of his own. It is because of Abu'l Fazl passion for detail and accuracy that the rules of this elaborate Chaupar descendant have been preserved to this day, as part of a seperate chapter on Amusements.

23895.name: How to make a Million!
23895.description:
From the game:

"Sport, Business, Crime and Acting. Choose the career that suits you best and set about making your million, but remember, life is never easy. Apart from the pitfalls built into your career, your scheming rivals will be plotting your downfall.
Build up your tactical defenses and plan attacks on your opponents, or join forces with an ally to fight a common foe.
Lawsuits, Court Orders and Suspensions may all be used against your rivals and a timely gamble could help you win the game.
You will need all your skills to make a million, have you got what it takes?"

23896.name: DragonRune: Arena of Death!
23896.description:
DragonRune: Arena of Death! is a gladiatorial-style, fantasy, miniatures combat game designed for two or more players. The rules are simple and fast, with a wide range of options for gladiator design.

The Arena of Death rules are based on a modified version of Munera Sine Missione, but made to reflect the fantasy theme of the game with added races and size modifiers of the gladiators, and with a built in character advancement system.

The free rules and accessories are downloaded here:
http://hutchs-wargames.co.uk/Fantasyrules.html

23897.description: Based on the comic stip Beetle Bailey.
23897.name: Beetle Bailey: The Old Army Game

23898.name: Wagon Wheels To Oregon
23898.description:
"A fun-filled, easy to play, adventurous skill and action game, that projects the pioneer spirit of making a goal. Setting forth on a journey of many unknowns, hardships, pleasant encounters with Indians and more; only to find that their very goal could prove more treacherous by nature than that of a bow and arrow.

With the visual amazement of illustrated cards, players will be entertained and stunned by the game's twisting of fate, while reliving moment through trails and triumphs of pioneers long past."

Contents:

112 Illustrated Cards
4 Trail Markers (Game Pieces)
1 Game Dice
Gameboard
Instruction Booklet

23899.name: Wide World of Sports Tennis Game
23899.description:
From the introduction to the rules:

"This fast-moving card game duplicates the strategy of the fast growing American sport. You try to outplay your opponent just as you would on a tennis court!"

The game consists of the following:

- A scoreboard
- 4 Pawns (2 yellow, 2 blue)
- A tennis court
- A spinner for service results
- 2 deck of cards (one deck for returns, one deck for shot types).

23901.name: Dr Fox's the Pepsi Chart No. 1 Board Game
23901.description:
From the box:

"You've just launched three new singles ... they're hot and ready to trot ... hovering just outside the Pepsi Chart Top 50! BUT, so have your rivals just across the table ... WHO is going to be first to the NUMBER ONE slot?? "Take a chance, Take a chance" as some Swedish group once said. Rock and Roll that dice and get those records moving up the chart! It's not just a steady climb upwards, things can go Down just as easily. On the way you may have a FLOP or two, all just one of life's set backs on the way to fame and fortune. Pick yourself up, dust yourself down, and start all over again! Still, you'll need more than a little POP knowledge if, or WHEN you land on one of those tricky little 'trivia' spaces. Good luck. See you at Number ONE!"

'Nuff said!

23902.name: The Wombles Games
23902.description:
Two games in one via a double-sided board.

The Wombles 'Underground Overground Game' and the Wombles 'Bananas and Springs Game'.

'Underground Overground' is traversing the board to land on 'newspaper' squares to collect newspapers for Uncle Bulgaria. The first to collect three newspapers and take them to Uncle Bulgaria wins the game.

'Bananas and Springs' is a stretched out version of snakes and ladders.

For those of a certain age in the UK, the Wombles were a ubiquitous group of furry animals on Wimbeldon Common who tidied up the rubbish - well before eco concerns hit the world stage. (Pictures of Madame Cholet are included!)

All together now -

"Underground Overground Wombling free,
The Wombles of Wimbledon Common are we.
Making good use of the things that we find,
Things that the everyday folks leave behind."

So, just "Remember you're a Womble!" and get that board on the table.

23903.name: BBC TV's One to Win
23903.description:
From the box:

" The quick fire quiz game where you cover numbers until you need ... ONE TO WIN!

Here's your chance to test your general knowledge to the limit and play the hit TV quiz just like a real game show contestant.
The questions come hard and fast so there's never a dull moment - just a whole lot of fun for friends and family!
Finish the proverb "Absence makes the heart ..." Decide whether the tomato is a fruit or a vegetable, whether tortoises have teeth and whether or not a maharajah is an Indian prince.
Will you be the first to cover your score board completely and attempt the Word Challenge?
Lose the challenge and you'll lose half your hard earned-points. But as they say, its tough at the top if you really want to be 'The One to Win'!"

23904.name: Toot! Toot! A Train Game for Tiny Tots
23904.description:
This a game designed for children 4-8 and has wooden trains, cardboard signal lights, and a board that has a track on it.

On each turn the child tries to move a to colored space on the track and "builds" his train to make his delivery at the end. First complete train around the track wins. The interesting part in what would be a simple roll and move is that the "roll" is dexterity-based, you have to roll a marble in a box with holes - this determines the color in which to move your train to... Good for developing fine motor skills.

23906.name: Cry Wolf!
23906.description:
The players are shepherds in medieval Spain seeking to expand and make wise investments in their flocks. Throughout the game they choose from among the roles of Lambing, Market Day, Place Investments, Cry Wolf, Bear, Barter and Stray Sheep.

In lambing, the players can choose to cooperate and help the other shepherds or go it alone, in hopes of receiving a larger return. As the players all cooperate, the predator threat from the wolves and bear is minimized. If any player chooses not to cooperate, then the predator threat grows, usually threatening the non-cooperative players the most.

If the Cry Wolf role is chosen, then the players must (in an order determined by earlier play) roll a twelve-sided die to determine whether their flock has been attacked. Once a flock is attacked, the remaining players’ flocks are safe for the rest of the round. There are many different ways a player can minimize the predator threat to herself.

In order to make investments, a player must sell his sheep (which are also points at the end of the game) and then place the gold received as investments in a Ram, Best Pasture, Market Stand, Guard Dog, Gaita, or Divine Intervention. The largest investment in each of these areas provides advantages throughout the game as well as additional points at the end of the game.

Cry Wolf! uniquely employs a modified “prisoner’s dilemma” in lambing which is integrated with a typically increasing and dynamic predator threat. The majority area control of investments combined with the timing of placement being determined through variable phase order also provides challenging strategic choices.

23907.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Board Game
23907.description:
From the box:
This fast-moving and exciting family board game follows faithfully 'The Two Towers', the second part of the blockbuster motion picture trilogy by New Line Cinema.

An original and easy to learn gameplay full of twists and turns, allows you to experience all the adventures of the remaining members of The Fellowship as they continue their treacherous journey, battling with Mordor in their quest to save Middle-earth.

Alternatively you could choose to play Mordor itself as it seeks to destroy The Fellowship and gain possession of The One Ring.

With Frodo and Sam (accompanied by Gollum) heading for Mordor, Merry and Pippin held captive by the Uruk-hai and Orcs, with Legolas, Gimli and Aragorn in hot pursuit, The Fellowship are no longer in one group. Will Gandalf's reappearance at Fangorn help in their epic struggle and, even if The Fellowship and its allies repel the attack of the Warg Riders on the Plains of Rohan and then successfully destroy Isengard, will the huge battle at Helm’s Deep prove too much? The resolve and determination of Mordor remains undiminished as it struggles to regain the ultimate power and it will stop at nothing in its quest to defeat The Fellowship.

Skill, strategy and luck will play their part in your success or failure and, whether you choose to play good or evil, there will be no respite and no place to hide – The One Ring must be destroyed if Middle-earth is to survive.

23908.name: Metromania
23908.description:
Metromania is a game of placement and connection which allows 2 to 4 players to build a subway network between different cities.

Each player builds 2 different subway lines, trying to go through the city and connect important places of housing, work, and leisures. After a construction phase, trip-tests verify the best and quickest lines.

The mechanism is easy: during his turn, a player puts 3 line counters on the board. If his line meets another line, a station is built where the two connect. The subway network is developed through this process. Because the grid on the board and the line counters are triangular, players have some real placement questions.

The game is very interactive, with players sometimes trying to cooperate and sometimes trying to stop other lines. They also choose, during the construction phase, the start and the end of the final trip-tests. But it's never the same player who places both start and end, so a player must anticipate and guess carefully.

23909.name: Metricat10n
23909.description: Boardgame used to teach the metric system through board interaction and the collection of metric bills. Game play is roll and move and players win by collecting 10 bills from each of 7 sets of metric measures.

23910.name: FOO: Fundamental Order of Operations
23910.description: This game teaches the order of operation. Players arrange cards in a frame in order to create formulas which result in a multiple of 12. There are 78 cards and four frames used for arranging cards. The cards bear the numbers 1 through 9 and symbols for addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, parentheses, brackets, and exponents.

23911.name: Say-it Subtraction
23911.description: This bingo-style game is used to teach basic subtraction problem recognition for 2-6 players. Game includes 6 subtraction sheets and 100 problem cards.

23912.name: Dread Pirate: Buccaneer's Revenge
23912.description: This rousing game of cut-throat action takes the best elements of Dread Pirate and throws in some new twists. Each player now partakes in specific missions which help him collect booty and navigate the treacherous seas. Action cards introduce a whole new series of pirate engagements and adventure.

23913.name: League of Pirates
23913.description:
Two players compete to place the best pirates on their respective ships as they "recruit", "press gang" and "raid" for the pirates they need.

The game comes with over 40 unique and beautifully illustrated pirate coins suitable for collecting. Thematically linked to the "Dread Pirate" and "Dread Pirate: Buccaneer's Revenge" games.

23914.name: Impact: The Battle for Wolf Ridge
23914.description:
Stand-alone game that may be integrated with Impact.

3 levels of play, basic level (1) is just a children's miniatures game with units that can fire rockets. Setup your men (or dinos) and try to knock over your opponents' by shooting them.

Level '2' introduces movement.

Level '3' introduces capture, special tunnel movement and different troop types.

Integrates with:

Impact

23915.description:
In Solitaire Caesar the player re-creates the rise and fall of the Roman Empire from 300BC to 1453AD.

You will lead the legions of Rome to victory, and then struggle to preserve the legacy of Empire from Barbarian onslaughts.

This is a solitaire wargame. It is province based, and will take approximately 60 minutes to play.

The game has been extensively play tested (by people on BGG), here are some comments from play testers:

"The theme of the game is truly amazing. During the game you feel like hordes of barbarians are attacking you from everywhere....The game is brilliant. I enjoy a lot playing and right now a big 9 is given to it. As I said you get the feeling you are leading Rome and it has a lot of theme into
it." NP

"I could definitely see myself playing this on slow work days or in the evenings when I don't have an opponent and my girlfriend is busy or out." CT

"So, I really like this game. I think it has a solid future." TD

"Super - elegant and concise rules wedded to an engaging subject!...the game really does impose interesting strategic choices on the player." Rg

"Overall I find it an incredibly enjoyable game I'd gladly pay money for!" CB

The link to the game is:

http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=339&;pics=

Ave!
23915.name: Solitaire Caesar

23916.name: Indiana Jones Card Game
23916.description:
Indiana Jones Card Game is a fast paced 'Print and Play' Card Game for 2 or more players. Players will take it in turns to draw a card, or play a card, trying to defeat villains and acquire highest number of valuable artifacts.

To acquire the game for free, the game visit the site below;

http://mmboardgames.page.tl/

Indiana Jones is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.

boardgamehonor: 2007 Charles S. Roberts Best Magazine-Published Boardgame Nominee
2007 Charles S. Roberts Best Magazine-Published Boardgame Winner
23917.description:
"June 3. Cold Harbor. I was killed."

Thus read the last diary entry, found in the pocket of a dead Union soldier. He had made the entry himself, while all around him, other soldiers were writing names and home addresses on slips of paper and pinning them to the back of their coats.

These veteran soldiers knew what was coming, although it seems their commanders did not. Three full corps launched a disjointed attack against well-entrenched Confederates. In just eight minutes, the attack had petered out. Over 7000 Federals covered the Virginia soil. A few minutes later, the orders came down to renew the attacks, but at each level, from corps commander to captain, the orders were "followed" only by increased firing -- most of it blindly -- while remaining in position.

Grant said, "I regret this assault more than any one I ever ordered." Today it sounds more like WWI madness than part of Grant's successful campaign to end the Civil War.

But it was not so easy on the other side. While one CSA staffer called it "perhaps the easiest victory ever granted to Confederate arms by the folly of Federal commanders," from Lee's point of view, anything could happen. His army had "not a regiment" in reserve, and the volume of sound -- "It seemed more like a volcanic blast than a battle," -- rattled windows all the way back in Richmond.

Not War But Murder covers the week-long operation which marked the end of Grant's 30 day, "smash 'em up" campaign begun at Wilderness. Like a bloody chess match, Grant and Lee made move and counter move to get to this point, with Lee well aware that a false move could end the war quickly.

Not War But Murder, by designer Michael Rinella, is his newest area-map game, and his first take on an American Civil War battle. This game includes one 22" by 34" inch area map, 176 5/8" counters, and 16 pages of rules and charts that include extensive examples of play, designer notes, and variant rules. It also marks the debut of what Rinella calls the "diceless advantage". In previous area-impulse games, from Monty's Gamble all the way to the Avalon Hill games of the early 1990s, an "advantage chit" allowed the person holding it to re-roll an single die roll (or rolls if it was a combat). In NWBM this changes. The player may spend the advantage to gain specific game benefits, automatically. Thus, rather than being hoarded, this "twist of fate" is likely to hop back and forth, as each player strives to save a desperate situation.

What is most amazing about NWBM is how much of a "game" it actually is, offering both players challenges and fateful decisions to make, in this classic face-off of well-known leadership. What will you do?
23917.name: Not War But Murder

23918.name: First Strike
23918.description: From the front of the box: "First Strike: A fast action game of superpower conquest. Return to the cold war crisis. Checker style play with dog fights, tank assaults, and infantry combat."

23919.description:
Another addition to the venerable Empire Builder series of crayon rail games. This time around, players are building track and making deliveries in The People's Republic of China and Taiwan.

This one is rather similar in to other Empire Builder games, plus have some unique events that are tailored to the map (i.e. Congress event). Cards tend to indicate that one needs to venture out west to have any hope of getting the big payoffs.
23919.name: China Rails

23920.description:
From the publisher's website:

Two hundred years of bloody battles, deadly feuds and constant raiding have turned the Scottish Borders into a virtual no mans land. Every clan raids, battles and pillages its neighbors, regardless of national ties, and the crowns of England and Scotland turn a blind eye to the chaos. Clan loyalties are all that matter, every opponent has a grievance and anything you can steal is yours if you can get it home. You play a Border clan, warring with and raiding your neighbors, fortifying your borders and taming the landscape as you try to establish your dominance of the Borders through the 15th and 16th Centuries. Use economic, military and subterfuge strategies to thwart the neighboring clans and advance your clan to eminence.

Border Reivers is a game of strategy, warfare and chance for 2 to 4 players, aged 12 to adult. Games last 30 to 90 minutes.
23920.name: Border Reivers

23921.name: Tumblo!
23921.description: Played on a 23x23 board, each player has five pieces, from a 1x1x1 cube to a 1x1x5 block. A move consists of rotating a piece about one of its sides touching the board, so you can make a piece "fall over", "stand up" or "roll". The objective is to get all your pieces off the board by moving them to the center of the board (covering the pink star). Complication is provided by if you cover one of the stars of another player's color you move one of his pieces back to the start. If you cover one of your own stars you get another turn. Half of the stars are occupied by counters, one of which is moved to immediately cover any star a piece moves off.

23922.name: What's The Score?
23922.description:
This set of 144 ChalkTalk Hockey quiz cards is great fun to play alone or with friends or family. It's guaranteed to challenge your knowledge on hockey facts, history and rules of this great game. Includes 72 True and False questions and 72 multiple choice. Can also be used as a booster card set for ChalkTalkHOCKEY Trivia Action Board Game.

A great card game to bring along on those hockey road trips!

23923.description:
Auto Assault TCG is a fast-paced digital trading-card game for two players based on the fastest, most explosive MMO ever!

As a member of one of three factions, Biomek, Human and Mutant, you command a high-performance vehicle, and must destroy your opponent’s vehicle or complete four missions for the win. Along the way, you’ll need to master maneuvers, gear, tactics and your vehicle itself. Each faction has four classes with their own strengths and weaknesses, and it’s up to you to discover them!

Auto Assault TCG: Ignition is a 339-card base set and is available in a number of introductory packages. Starter decks and boosters are also available.
23923.name: Auto Assault TCG

23924.name: Stock Exchange
23924.description: Stock market game where players try to amass money in a specified time limit or play to a set monetary goal. Players move around the board buying and selling shares of, primarily, commodities. The price is determined by "price index cards," that periodically change when players land on certain squares. There is also an auction mechanic and events cards that increase or decrease demand for certain products. The game has a heavy lucky factor.

23925.description:
Scenario Book 1 offers six new scenarios for the game Cry Havoc, plus rules for using lead miniatures with Cry Havoc and Siege. Each scenario defines the maps, starting positions, and victory conditions. Some of the scenarios have special rules.

The scenarios are The Knight Errant, The Foraging Party, The Knight's Lady, Reconnaissance Patrol, The Rescue, and The Battle of Little Wootton (a two part scenario).

Part of the Cry Havoc series.
23925.name: Cry Havoc Scenario Book 1

23926.description:
Scenario Book 2 contains 29 scenarios for the game Cry Havoc, Siege, and Outremer. Some of the scenarios combine two of the three games, and one combines all three.

While the majority of the scenarios are for two players, five were designed with solo play in mind (and others are suitable for solo play), and seven of the scenarios were designed for three or more players.

Four of the scenarios are campaign games, and rules for foraging, character advancement, money, encounters, and enemy actions are included.

Part of the Cry Havoc series.
23926.name: Cry Havoc Scenario Book 2

23927.name: Armego: The Board Game
23927.description:
In the twilight of the old era, the Earth suffers from the last colonial war. Gigantic mobile cities are fighting for global domination over the planet and its resources. As the leader of a warring faction, you control the destiny of your people. You've got to exploit raw materials, to build an army strong enough to destroy your enemies. You may build alliances, but take care of whom you trust. Manage your troops wisely, became a cunning diplomat and it can be you, who will be the first global ruler in the dawning of a new age of the Earth.

Armego contains:

* 1 game board (4 pieces)
* 16 bases
* 160 combat units
* 4 status cards
* 4 rule summary cards
* 9 help maps
* banknotes
* 2 six-sided dice
* 1 rulebook

23928.description:
(from GMT web site :)

Glory III is the third game in GMT's popular American Civil War series, Glory. This series presents a brigade-level system that highlights ease and speed of play combined with solid historical insight. Glory III follows the success of Glory II: Across the Rappahannock, and presents a polished system with ease of play, with two combat-intensive one-map battles. And it is still a game that can be played, and played well, by solitaire gamers.

Glory III features GMT's unique chit activation mechanic, which provides a great deal of play tension, as the commanders never quite know what is going to happen next. However, new command and combat mechanics make the game even more fun. Both battles have special command problems and some new and interesting mechanics to allow the players to play within the framework of those conditions.

Antietam, one of the major battles of the war, makes great use of the Glory activation system, linking the Union/McClellan command problems directly to its use. But it still allows the player to make choices, choices different from those Little Mac made, perhaps changing the course of the battle.

Cedar Creek is a great momentum battle, with an initial, probably highly effective Confederate surprise attack followed by the return of General Phil Sheridan to the battlefield, the arrival of George Custer's repeater-armed cavalry, and, hopefully for the Union Player, enough of a counter-attack to snatch victory from Jubal Early's rapidly munching jaws. Has Jubal bitten off more than he can chew? Grab your wallet, roll the die and find out!

Designed gloriously by Richard H Berg, Developed with consummate skill and dedication by a new star on the industry horizon, Jim Dauphinais, playtested to a fine edge, and featuring the usual eye-popping, drool-inducing GMT graphics, Glory III is the best game yet in the Glory series.

Components:


1 22 x 34 backprinted map
2 counter sheets
Rulebook
1 die
Player Aid Cards


Designer: Richard Berg
Developer: Jim Dauphinais

Game 3 in the GMT Glory Civil War game series. This series features battles recreated at the Brigade level with each game in the series featuring 2 battles from the Civil War. In this edition of the series the two battles are Antietam and Cedar Creek.

The Glory system features a unique chit activation mechanic. This results in players unsure of when or if a certain field commander will carry out your orders. The game system is designed for playability over bookkeeping. The main rules are only 12 pages long. Scenarios run from 2 hours for Burnside's late afternoon attack at Antietam, up to 6 hours for Cedar Creek and up to 12 hours for the full battle of Antietam (if it needs to go the distance for a decision).
23928.name: Glory III

23929.name: Divorce Cope
23929.description:
A unique and fun game to help parent and children cope with divorce.

Divorce cope takes you through the ups and downs of divorce. As you go around the Divorce Cope board, you'll deal with real life situations which families of divorce experience. These include child support, custody battles, school problems and step-families.

Players deposit anger, depression and loneliness cards and pick up happy times, independence and optimism cards, competing for growth points along the way. 250 specially designed questions will help you and your children understand each other's feelings while having fun.

Divorce Cope will open a whole new world of communication between you!

23930.name: Head-On Football
23930.description:
From the rule book: "This is it, your chance to be a star! Epyx Head-On Football is designed to follow the same rules as professional football. However, you may make changes in the rules or adjustments in gameplay if it suits your needs. With this game, you're in charge, you call all the shots."

This is a 2 player game that roughly simulates a game of American football. There are two decks of cards which represent offensive and defensive plays.

The defensive cards have a red tinted window that line up 'decoder style' on the offensive card to reveal the outcome of the play. Periodically the outcome will be "xx tape xx" which means to activate the audio cassette tape included and listen to the "play by play action". The announcer will then tell you the outcome of the play.

Then the football pawn is moved down the board accordingly. There are markers for keeping track of what down it is and the score.

Dice are used to determine the success of Field Goal and Punt attempts.

The rules suggest not rewinding the cassette tape until reaching the end of the tape, thus keeping some level of randomness.

Components:
Audio cassette with over 200 highlight plays.
20 Offensive formations and plays.
12 Defensive plays.
Game board
6 sided die
Offensive play holder (also marks scrimage line)
Football pawn
5 colored rings used for scoring

23931.description:
Join the fight against rare genetic diseases by becoming a DNA engineer in the fast-paced mind-bending card game Gene Pool! Use strategy and spatial thinking to mutate, invert, delete and insert your way to success!

How do you play? You compete against your opponent to repair important genes of various length and difficulty with gene therapy. Make these repairs by modifying and rearranging a common DNA sequence with the cards you have in hand. Your current genetic research goals are private and are revealed only when they can be found within the DNA sequence. Continue repairing genes until one player completes enough research to win the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine — and the game!
23931.name: Gene Pool
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGTG 64 - Oct 23, 2006 - SR & Feedback show (Thurn und Taxis, Gene Pool, Wallamoppi)

23932.description:
The Dwarven Labyrinth is the fourth supplement to the Chronopia universe. It describes in great length the subterranean realms of the Dwarves.

The 96 pages book contains:
- detailed background about the undergrounds of Chronopia, expanding on the storyline of the main rulebook;
- rules for fighting in all kinds of interior settings, from big undergrounds caves to multi-story dungeon warfare;
- a bunch of new units for all the races of Chronopia;
- an optional card system to simulate the hazards of tunnel fighting.
23932.name: Chronopia: The Dwarven Labyrinth
boardgameexpansion: Chronopia: War in the Eternal Realm

23933.name: Zobmondo Lite: The Prequel
23933.description:
From the back of the box...

More of the same outrageous, mind-blowing content that made the original Would You Rather...? so successful...only now it's not just for adults. Find out what someone is really like by discussing the imaginary hypotheticals of Zobmondo Lite. Plus this version has all new questions.

Object of the game: Above all, to simulate entertaining, ridiculous conversation. More precisely, to advance to the middle of the game board, by predicting how friends will answer outrageous, gross, thought-provoking and hilarious Zobmondo "would you rather" questions.

23934.name: Star Wars Missions
23934.description:
Star Wars Missions is a simple solitaire adventure game. Each mission is a 74-page book which contains the start of a story, a mission briefing (telling the player what cards may be used), and then the rest of the story. After the mission briefing the player chooses a character card and a specified number of weapon, vehicle, and ability cards which can be used on the mission. At many points in the story the player will be required to use a weapon, a vehicle, or an ability, to check against a skill level, and in some cases to choose one of several possible courses of action.

The object is to complete all the missions without running out of mission points. While the player in general cannot lose a confrontation, if he or she does badly mission points will be lost. When playing on the advanced level every weapon, vehicle, and ability costs missions points for every use.

The basic set includes 1 mission book, 1 mission blueprint (a diagram of locations), and 12 cards in addition to the rulebook, score pad, log book, rules summary sheet, and dice. Supplemental missions were sold, each consisting of a mission book, mission blueprint, and additional cards.

The missions are:
1 - Assault on Yavin Four (included in basic set)
2 - Escape from Thyferra
3 - Attack on Delrakin
4 - Destroy the Liquidator
5 - The Hunt for Han Solo
6 - The Search for Grubba the Hutt
7 - Ithorian Invasion
8 - Togorian Trap
9 - Revolt of the Battle Droids
10 - Showdown in Mos Eisley
11 - Bounty Hunter vs. Battle Droids
12 - The Vactooine Disaster
13 - Prisoner of the Nikto Pirates
14 - The Monsters of Dweem
15 - Voyage to the Underworld
16 - Imperial Jailbreak
17 - Darth Vader's Return
18 - Rogue Squadron to the Rescue
19 - Bounty on Bonadan
20 - Total Destruction

23935.name: Oshi
23935.description:
From the publisher's website:

Oshi, which means “Push,” is inspired by a Japanese legend in which the Goddess Amaterasu gifted the first Japanese emperor with her ancient wisdom, in the form of a game. The game is said to have taught the emperor and his court to temper their influence and power with caution.

The goal is to be the first player to push seven points worth of your opponent’s game pieces off the board. Each player begins the game with eight game pieces shaped to look like one-, two- and three-story Japanese buildings. The number of stories a piece has equals the number of spaces it can move, the maximum number of other pieces it can push and the number of points it is worth if pushed off the board. Pieces move side to side and forward and backward.

Contents:
Game board.
Eight oxblood (red) pieces.
Eight ivory (white) pieces.
Complete rules.

23936.description: The second expansion for the Commander's Edition of Star Fleet Battles, covering technologically advanced X-ships. Includes a 32 page SSD book for X-Ships, a 24 page rule/scenario book, and 108 die-cut counters. Races covered are the Federation, Orions, Tholians, Romulans, Gorns, Kzinti, Klingons, Hydrans, WYN, I.S.C, and Lyrans
23936.name: Star Fleet Battles Supplement #2: X-Ships
boardgameexpansion: Star Fleet Battles: Commander's Rulebook Volume II

23937.name: Slim Chance
23937.description:
Players compete "to gain the least amount of weight by answering questions about Diet, Nutrition, and Health." The playing surface rings the board in an 8x8 square. Pawns move the number of spaces indicated on a die roll. The game lasts for five rounds of five turns each, for a total of 25 turns.

A player "gains weight" either by landing on the buffet space (thereby overindulging) or landing on a colored square. If the latter, the player must correctly answer a question from a supplied card to avoid the weight gain. (The cards give both the correct answer and its rationale, to provide an educational experience for the players.)

Players "lose weight" either by landing on the "Fat Farm" or by correctly answering a question when landing on the "Slim Chance" space.

Players sent to the "Pig Pen" must wear a supplied Pig Mask until their next turn.

23938.name: Spirou Safari
23938.description:
Magazine game from Spirou # 1782 "Special Vacances"

Components: Map, 5 paper vehicles (2 Land Rovers, 1 Land Rover pickup, 1 Jeep, 1 Helicopter), several cards (Money, Fuel, Tires, Radios, Animals)

2 Players represent hunters, 1 player has the role of poacher, 2 players represent the Police: jeep and helicopter

Hunters and Poachers hunt the animals
Police: Jeep tries to catch the poacher
Police Helicopter tries to catch the poacher and rescue the hunters from several dangers

23939.description:
There are two versions of Star Fleet Battles Supplement #1: Fighters and Shuttles.

The first version requires ownership of the "Boxed" edition of Star Fleet Battles (known as the Designer's Edition) as well as all three (ziplock) expansions to that version.

The second version of this is also the first expansion for the Commander's Edition of Star Fleet Battles, adding new rules for direct firing drones, fighter vs. fighter dogfighting rules, and new ship types. Includes 10 new ship and 5 new fighter group SSD pages, a 20 page rule/scenario book, and 216 die-cut counters. Races covered are the Federation, Tholians, Romulans, Gorns, Kzinti, Klingons, Hydrans, and Lyrans
23939.name: Star Fleet Battles Supplement #1: Fighters and Shuttles
boardgameexpansion: Star Fleet Battles: Commander's Rulebook Volume II

23940.description:
Kids who think, talk, and dream about horses all day long will be crazy about this deck of Horsin' Around card games.

The Jump! deck will have English and Western riders alike jumping, racing, and spinning their way through the lineup of six card games. Deal out the cards and get ready to jockey for first place in "Neck and Neck," a contest in which riders try to gallop the farthest on a tabletop track. Vie to become top horse in the field by winning all the cards in the game of "Pecking Order." Then use your ESP (Equine Sensory Perception) to make the right matches in the challenging memory game of "Horse Sense."

The Jump! cards are full-color and depict all things horse related, from types of feeds, grooming tools, tack and riding accessories to a variety of fun facts that will really give horse lovers plenty to talk about! Each deck comes with a bonus gift of four collectible horse breeds cards.

Dedicated horse fans--and even kids who don't know a gait from a gate--will enjoy these fun, fast-paced games.
23940.name: Jump!: A Horsin' Around Card Game

23941.description:
